title: Broken Wheat Halwa🌾 / Godhuma Rava Halwa 😋 || Sweet || Navratri Special Dessert 🙏
content:
Quick and healthy sweet recipe: Andhra recipe  Servings : 5  Duration : 20 mins Wheat 🌾 is cultivated all over the world, it can be used as flour, broken wheat. Many varieties of dishes can be made out of wheat, wheat flour and broken wheat. Such as cakes, Roti, Upma, snacks, Bread, whole wheat bread etc., Recipes I prepared with wheat/ wheat flour: check below links: Methi Paratha/ Fenugreek leaves Paratha || Punjabi Style Chapathi/ Roti Multi Grain 🌾 Roti/ 5 flour rottallu/ Healthy Nutrition Roti Radish Paratha / Mooli Paratha / Mulangi Paratha Rava Dosa Nutrition facts of Broken Wheat 🌾: It contains protein  Today, I prepared a sweet recipe with broken wheat which is the main ingredient, milk, sugar and garnish with cashew nuts. Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: Broken wheat - 60 gms Sugar - 80 gms Milk - 235 ml Ghee - 1 tsp Garnish : Cashew nuts - 6 to 7 Poppy seeds - 1/2 tsp Dry coconut powder - 1/2 tb sp Ghee - 1 tsp Procedure: Garnish Process:
  • Heat a deep bowl/ pan / tempering pan on medium heat
  • Add 1/2 tsp ghee and roast cashew nuts
  • When cashew nuts half roasted, add poppy seeds
  • Saute them
  • Add dry coconut powder/ dry grated coconut
  • Saute 30 secs and take out in a plate
Broken Wheat/ Godhuma Rava Halwa preparation:
  • Boil milk in a bowl/ pan on medium heat
  • When milk started boiling add broken wheat/ godhuma rava in it
  • Mix well & stir
  • Cook 2 mins
  • Add sugar and mix well
  • Cook 5 mins
  • Add 1 tsp ghee and mix well
  • Cook 5 to 7 mins
  • Stir occasionally, when the content becoming thick
  • Apply ghee on a plate
  • Dish out on it
  • Tap twice and spread
  • Let it become cool for 15 to 20 mins
  • Garnish with roasted cashew nuts mixture
  • Take a knife and cut vertically and horizontally to make square shape
  • As shown in pictures
  • Dish out in a serving bowl/ Plate
  • Offer this special dessert to Godess Durga Mata, hope all of you celebrating festival with happiness 😀 and blessings from Godess Durga Mata
  • You can also prepare this in other festivals/ spl occasions too
  • Happy & Healthy cooking 😊
